function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Distribution of survey through social media outlets and online networks"},{"name":"Not all respondents answering all survey questions"},{"name":"Online survey with open comment question on health in buildings may pose privacy and confidentiality risks for respondents."},{"name":"Multiple-choice questions with no restrictions on the number of answers may lead to data ambiguity and incomplete information."},{"name":"Professionals’ responses may vary based on individual perspectives and biases, leading to subjective data collection."},{"name":"Professionals may not prioritize occupant health in building design and operation."},{"name":"Lack of focus on occupant health in building projects."},{"name":"Data-related challenges in achieving design and operation of buildings that promote occupant health."},{"name":"Mix of academia and industry respondents may lead to conflicting views on occupant health in buildings."},{"name":"Limited representation of doctors and public health workers in the survey may lead to a lack of expertise in health assessment."},{"name":"Covid-19 pandemic impact on building professional opinions may result in temporary shifts that are not sustainable for long-term health assessment strategies."},{"name":"Unequal focus on physical well-being in research"},{"name":"Professional focus on holistic approach to building health"},{"name":"Limited research on social well-being in the built environment"},{"name":"Skewed focus on physical well-being in literature review"},{"name":"Difficulty in conducting research on social well-being in built environment"},{"name":"Spread of highly infectious airborne virus"},{"name":"Inadequate guidelines for building attributes"},{"name":"Limited research on building attributes"},{"name":"Poor indoor air quality due to pollutants such as volatile organic compounds, carbon monoxide, nitrogen dioxide, and particulates"},{"name":"Lack of focus on ventilation and indoor air quality, exacerbated by the covid-19 pandemic"},{"name":"Inadequate attention to musculoskeletal pain and mental health issues related to building design"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation due to sick building syndrome symptoms like red/watery eyes, runny/blocked nose, itchy/dry throat and skin."},{"name":"Limited research on ergonomics settings in buildings and its musculoskeletal consequences on occupants."},{"name":"Discrepancy between professionals’ opinions about the prevalence of musculoskeletal pain and limited research focus in this area."},{"name":"High levels of stress, depression, and anxiety due to stay-at-home mandates and lack of social connections."},{"name":"Increased concentration loss due to stay-at-home mandates and stress."},{"name":"Concentration loss and stress as part of sick building syndrome"},{"name":"Collaboration needed between building scientists and health professionals"},{"name":"Need for more research on mental well-being in built environments"},{"name":"Reliance on occupant assessments and judgments for post-occupancy evaluation may lead to inaccurate or biased data regarding the indoor environment."},{"name":"Privacy concerns among building occupants due to the continuous collection of personal physiological and psychometric data."},{"name":"Difficulty in effectively collecting and analyzing physiological and psychometric data, requiring coordination with data scientists and comprehensive data storage and analysis infrastructure."},{"name":"Reliance on subjective questionnaires for health assessments in buildings"},{"name":"Limited use of physiological/psychometric measurements for occupant health assessments"},{"name":"Limited use of objective health measures in research studies"},{"name":"Low level of experience in improving occupant health in commercial and industrial buildings."},{"name":"Limited studies and research on occupant health in commercial and industrial buildings."},{"name":"Importance given to office spaces in research and practice, leading to neglect of other building types."},{"name":"Health issues persist with degraded ieq in building types"},{"name":"Lack of research on different building types and their impact on occupant health"},{"name":"Limited awareness and education among building professionals about the impact of their decisions on occupant health"},{"name":"Lack of collaboration between building practitioners, health professionals, and data scientists in enhancing the design of healthy buildings."},{"name":"Lack of establishment of building design guidelines as a standard for the design of healthy buildings."},{"name":"Lack of professional certification for healthy building design among design professionals."},{"name":"Inadequate building design for occupant health"},{"name":"Lack of occupant-centric building operation modules"},{"name":"Insufficient influence of facility managers on building health"},{"name":"Lack of understanding about the effects of buildings attributes on occupant health"},{"name":"Lack of effective collaboration between project stakeholders"}]}
